title: Learning Documentation Protocol
description: Systematic approach to documenting learnings, mistakes, and process improvements to prevent future agents from making the same errors
purpose: Capture critical learnings and mistakes in a way that future agents can understand and avoid, ensuring continuous improvement of the AI-SOP system
scope: All development work, process improvements, and critical mistakes that should be documented for future reference
commander_intent: How do we document learnings and mistakes so that future agents can understand what went wrong and avoid making the same errors?

sequence_steps.description: Recognize when a mistake, confusion, or improvement opportunity occurs
indicators: User provides feedback about process confusion
New agent would struggle with current process

sequence_steps.description: Test if a new agent could understand and execute the process correctly
pbj_test_questions: If a new agent picked up this codebase tomorrow, could they understand this process?
Would they know what constitutes a single work cycle?
Could they execute the spirit and letter of what we're looking for?
Are there any assumptions or context they might miss?
Is the process self-documenting and clear?

sequence_steps.description: Create comprehensive documentation of the learning or mistake

format.principle: Clear statement of the correct principle or approach
format.common_mistake: Description of what went wrong or was confusing
format.pbj_test: How this addresses the PB&J test for new agents
format.impact: Why this learning is important for future work

sequence_steps.description: Integrate the learning into existing SOPs or create new ones
methods: Add critical_learnings section to existing SOPs
Update sequence steps to prevent the mistake
Create new SOPs if needed for complex learnings

sequence_steps.description: Document the learning in agent memory for immediate recall

memory_format.context: When and where this learning occurred
memory_format.application: How to apply this learning in future work

sequence_steps.description: Ensure the learning is documented clearly enough for future agents
validation_criteria: New agent could understand the principle without confusion
Common mistake is clearly identified and explained
Correct approach is step-by-step and actionable
Documentation is integrated into relevant SOPs

success_criteria: Learning is documented with clear principle and common mistake
PB&J test is addressed for new agent understanding
Relevant SOPs are updated with the learning
Memory entry is created for immediate recall
Documentation is clear enough for future agents to avoid the mistake

documentation_standards.clarity: Documentation must be clear enough for a new agent to understand without additional context
documentation_standards.specificity: Include specific examples and scenarios, not just general principles
documentation_standards.actionability: Provide step-by-step guidance on how to apply the learning
documentation_standards.integration: Integrate learnings into existing SOPs rather than creating separate documentation
documentation_standards.validation: Always apply PB&J test to ensure new agent understanding

common_learning_categories.work_cycle_separation: Issues with mixing multiple work cycles in same branch/commits
common_learning_categories.issue_review: Skipping review of existing issues before creating new work
common_learning_categories.process_confusion: Unclear boundaries between different processes or steps
common_learning_categories.assumption_making: Making assumptions that new agents wouldn't have
common_learning_categories.context_missing: Missing critical context that new agents need

pbj_test_framework.purpose: Ensure any new agent can pick up the codebase and execute processes correctly
key_questions: Could a new agent understand what constitutes a single work cycle?
Would they know when to create new issues vs. extend existing ones?
Could they execute the spirit and letter of our processes?
Are there any hidden assumptions or context they might miss?
Is the process self-documenting and clear?
pbj_test_framework.validation_method: Documentation should answer all PB&J test questions explicitly

metadata.version_notes: Created to capture critical learnings about work cycle separation and process clarity
